Topic.Title: I didn't know Sally Ride supported Obama

Message.Msg: I am a supporter of the US Space Program. I believe it is Americans literally reaching for the stars. Reaching for the highest aspirations of the human race. I also believe that one way we can keep our planet cleaner and "a garden" is get all the heavy industry off it. We can find lots of ores, metals and minerals in the asteroid belt. We can maybe find hydrocarbons (oil?) in the gaseous planets if we can find a way to draw on them. We will have lots of room to expand if we get to space. Also: Our planet has been prone to GREAT catastrophes in the past (that comet killing off the dinosaurs was just ONE of seven or nine!) One way to protect our species from extinction is to get our species off this planet and into space. Lots of growth for our species right here in our solar system, Oort cloud and Kuiper belt. And yes, Sally Ride WAS a great hero. Anybody daring enough to ride in a space craft is a hero! Do you remember John Glen's comment on that? He was asked if he was ever afraid while riding the Mercury ship to be first American into space. He replied; "Of course I was terrified! I was riding on top of a giant roman candle build by the cheapest bidder on a government project!" If I recall, Sally Ride actually rode on the Challenger shuttle a few times before it exploded, killing the crew.

Message.Title: gop will raise taxes.....on the middleclass
Message.Msg: IN ONE SENTENCE: Just like Mitt Romney, Republicans in Congress want to raise taxes on the middle class in order to give the wealthiest Americans yet another handout that they don’t need..... All told, these Republican tax increases would hit more than 25 million poor, working, and middle class families. "Republicans Will Raise Taxes — Just Not on the Wealthy Republicans are holding middle class tax cuts hostage in order to give the wealthiest 2 percent of Americans yet another extra tax cut. If that wasn’t bad enough, the Republicans are now affirmatively proposing to raise taxes on tens of millions of poor and middle class Americans — even as they slash them on the wealthy. Here’s the rundown. If you want to know how Republicans really feel about the middle class, you need look no further than a doozy of a floor speech that Sen. Jon Kyl (AZ) — a member of the Senate Republican leadership — gave yesterday. Kyl attacked President Obama for “incessantly” talking about the middle class. And it’s not just their rhetoric that shows disdain for the middle class, it’s their actual proposals. TAX CUTS REPUBLICANS ARE HOLDING HOSTAGE: Tax cuts for 98 percent of Americans. (The wealthiest two percent would also still get a tax cut on their first $250,000 of income.) TAX CUTS REPUBLICANS ARE INSISTING ON: An extra tax cut for the wealthiest 2 percent of Americans, including millionaires and billionaires. TAX INCREASES REPUBLICANS WANT: Limiting eligibility for the child tax credit, which constitutes a tax increase on 12 MILLION families. This works out to an average tax increase of $800 per family. In the case of a family made up of one person earning minimum wage and two children, the tax increase would be much larger according to one estimate: $1545. Curtailing tax credits for higher education expenses from $2500 a year to $1800 and reducing the years of eligibility from four years to two. This translates into an average tax increase of $1100 for 11 MILLION families. Cutting back on the earned income tax credit for families with three or more children and worsening the so-called “marriage penalty” on working poor couples, which translates into an average tax increase of $500 for 6 MILLION families. All told, these Republican tax increases would hit more than 25 million poor, working, and middle class families. Worse yet, Republicans aren’t even being honest about their plans to raise taxes on millions of Americans. Here’s what Sen. Minority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) claimed earlier today: “Republicans will head into tomorrow’s vote guided by a simple principle: do no harm. In our view, the best approach to taxes right now is to let every American and every American business know they won’t have a higher income tax bill at the end of the year. We think everybody in America should have that certainty.” Unfortunately, the only people Republicans are really interested in letting know that they won’t see a tax increase are the wealthiest 2 percent of Americans. Republicans claim to care about the middle class, but they are holding middle class tax cuts hostage. And even as they promise more tax giveaways to the wealthy, Republicans want to raise taxes on 25 MILLION families — including some of the poorest Americans. Tomorrow, Senate Democrats will try and move forward with their plan to preserve middle class tax cuts while asking the wealthiest Americans to give up the extra tax cuts that they simply do not need and that we cannot afford.
So, you still don't know anything.
By the way did you do all this research when Obama ran for President, or maybe you could not see his records because he them sealed. Did you ever wonder why?

Topic.Title: I believe it is Americans literally reaching for the stars.

Message.Msg: One of the problems with the US Space Program was Kennedy. For him, getting to the moon was a publicity stunt to upstage the Russians. He never had a plan for what to do after the publicity stunt was over. Another problem was the space shuttle, which was a limited purpose vehicle from the beginning. And no one ever agreed on a plan for what space vehicle should follow. In part because there was never a vision of what program should follow. We should be planning to get off earth. Get a permanent, large, space station. Get to the moon. Get to Mars. Get to the asteroid belt. Start industry and colonization of space. Are you aware that all the little computerized gadgets you like to play with are in one way or another spin offs from the space program? It involved real, genuine research that sped up a number of industries and made American science & technology dominant in the world. Thus it spun off lots of entrepreneurs, businesses and jobs that no one could have conceived of in the beginning.

Message.Title: 5 year voter fraud investigation: 86 convictions
Message.Msg: In 5-Year Effort, Scant Evidence of Voter Fraud WASHINGTON, April 11 — Five years after the Bush administration began a crackdown on voter fraud, the Justice Department has turned up virtually no evidence of any organized effort to skew federal elections, according to court records and interviews. Although Republican activists have repeatedly said fraud is so widespread that it has corrupted the political process and, possibly, cost the party election victories, about 120 people have been charged and 86 convicted as of last year. http://www.nytimes.com/2007/04/12/washington/12fraud.html ( wow, 5 year long gop investigation found 86 guilty of voter fraud........so out of 150 million registered voters the gop found 86 instance of fraud .....or .00006%.........see how screwed up the gop is, that is what they spend time and money on, and worse they use their LIES to disenfranchise thousands of people by hassling them over BS)

Message.Msg: Japan National debt has been more than 100% of their gdp for about 20 years now........ and they are not loading up on ammo and going crazy and throwing tantrums. for perspective consider that the USA debt has been FAR higher than it is now.... and it wasn't the end and the pubs didn't go crazy then as now: "Many economists, such as the Brookings Institution's William Gale, say a better measure of the nation's debt is how much the government owes creditors, not counting $4.7 trillion owed to future Social Security recipients and other government beneficiaries. By that measure, the debt is roughly a third less: $10.5 trillion, or nearly 70% the size of the economy. That is still high by historic standards. The total national debt topped the size of the economy for three years during and after World War II. It dropped to 32.5% of the economy by 1981, then began a steady climb under President Reagan, doubling over the next 12 years." so our real debt is at 70% of gdp, not good , but there is plenty of time to do the right thing which, of course is to raise some taxes and cut some spending.

Only a delirious dishonest salesman of endless debts would try to compare Japan to the US.

Topic.Title: USA national debt (please don't throw a tantrum pubicans)

Message.Msg: The constant BS coming from mainstream sources - in addition to Mesa - is annoying. It's not that I'm smarter than them. It's that their insistence that borrowing and spending ever increasing amounts of money will solve all problems flies in the face of the most immediate common sense. - please let's forget about WW2 and Japan these were totally different situations. fake comparisons don't help anyone. - Can you dilute debt with inflation? Not if you create new money through new debt. Certainly not if you give all the new money to rich people who don't spend it. There is a scam at the root of this idea. - Then according to these guys, you can easily create end-demand by borrowing & spending more and more. Yeah well. Then what? It's like saying you can warm yourself in winter by burning your furniture. These people would make mister Ponzi turn red of shame. These ideas are not just wrong mathematically they are immoral as they reward bad participants and punish the virtuous. These ideas are not just immoral they are incredibly destructive. They already caused major damage to the economy and will continue to do so as long as they pass for wisdom. Without vested interests defending themselves, no one in their right minds would defend publicly such silly ideas.
I can't Believe This WOW

Topic.Title: USA national debt (please don't throw a tantrum pubicans)

Message.Msg: "Now the debt continues to grow 9%/yr on average JUST TO SUSTAIN THE STATUS QUO. " now you are just a liar. the usa is helpless to cut spending, raise revenue or grow gdp? the late 90s saw several years of surplus and the debt went down........ and OMG...... we survived!!!??? USA debt was higher than now for a decade the early 40s to early 50s..... and OMG.... gov spending was sharply cut and taxes were raised the debt fell rapidly and ....WE survived!!! one thing that was different then was: Previous generations were wiser and more honest, fairer and decent . The cost of World War II was financed primarily by a highly progressive Income Tax, as well as other taxes on corporations to prevent excess profits being derived from government contracts. Even the Vietnam War was largely financed by a surtax on incomes, paid largely by wealthier citizens rather than by the transfer of a payroll tax-generated social security Surplus to cover U.S. budget deficits.

Message.Title: USA debt is 70% of gdp
Message.Msg: Many economists, ...say a better measure of the nation's debt is how much the government owes creditors, not counting $4.7 trillion owed to future Social Security recipients and other government beneficiaries. By that measure, the debt is roughly a third less: $10.5 trillion, or nearly 70% the size of the economy. that is correct. for instance 10% of US debt is "owed" to the federal reserve ...... but not really since the fed pays it back to the government...... and as for SS. well THOSE trillions are not due tomorrow, right?..... get the picture? hence, we are at about 70% of debt-owed-to-the-public/gdp, and it has been far worse before in US history. and everything will work out fine as long as we adhere to the extended baseline projection of the cbo, which both ryan's plan and just getting rid of the bush tax cuts would achieve: Figure 1. Federal Debt Held by the Public, 1790 to 2035 http://www.cbo.gov/sites/default/files/cbofiles/ftpdocs/116xx/doc11659/07-27_debt_fiscalcrisis_brief.pdf

Topic.Title: USA national debt (please don't throw a tantrum pubicans)

Message.Msg: as i said, 10% of the national debt is just accounting for the federal reserve, if it gets paid back it goes straight to the treasury, so scrach that off. and there are other items like that. Maybe 3 trillion or so is "owed" to SS , but is it due tommorrow or next year or the next or the next.... NO , it is not..... all total of debt the government owes it self is 30% of the total..... you are the PHONY..... fyi a homeowner may, for instance owe 100% of his "gdp" on his 30 year mortgage. but guess what... and this is a key concept so pay attention..... he never has to pay the whole amount.... all he has to do is make the payments over the 30 years..... and even though he had that hair raising debt (to you) of 100% of his "gdp", he always had good credit and always paid his bills and was happy ever after. another way to look at what is owed to SS is that it too is owed over a period out to 2036 or so now , i think. SO.... that 3 trillion or what ever, is NOT really a percent of one year gdp, but a percent of 15 years of gdp... get the picture, 3 trillion divided by the 225 trillion gdp crude estimate for that period.......(1.3%) besides you keep ignoring that we get to a sustainable debt via the extended baseline projection of the cbo... either the hard way via gop and ryan severe cuts and recession, or in a couple of years gradually hike taxes back to the clinton era rates and cut defense spending and so forth.

Message.Msg: You are relying on a CBO report dated July 23, 2010. How did they know what the national debt would be by June 2012? They also made estimates to 2035. I am sure those are very meaningful too.

Voter fraud has a shocking new meaning in eastern Kentucky. That is where in some cases, major cocaine and marijuana dealers admitted to buying votes to steal elections, and the result is the corruption of American democracy. The government continues to mete out justice in the scandal, as two people convicted in April in a vote-buying case face sentencing this week, and another public official pleaded guilty Tuesday to conspiracy. "We believe that drug money did buy votes," Kerry B. Harvey, U.S. attorney for the Eastern District of Kentucky, said of a separate vote-buying case. He described a stunning vote-buying scheme that includes "very extensive, organized criminal activity, involving hundreds of thousands of dollars, and in many cases that involves drug money." Harvey has led a recent string of federal prosecutions exposing the widespread and accepted practice of vote buying in eastern Kentucky. The soft-spoken federal prosecutor, along with his team and state authorities, are waging a battle against what he characterizes as a vote-buying culture embedded in many of the communities for generations. He says the problem is rooted in economic woes, which is why votes are routinely for sale. In that part of the state, jobs are scarce and poverty is high. Controlling local government means controlling jobs. “These folks go out and hijack the local elections for their own purposes and then they use those jobs to enrich themselves and their confederates. It really is a terrible problem and it has to be stopped,” Harvey explains. In Clay County, according to court testimony, some of the funds to purchase votes came from massive cocaine and marijuana drug trafficking operations. "They did use drug money to buy votes, and drug dealers felt they would be protected," Harvey said. Prosecutors say more than $400,000, part of it drug proceeds, was pooled by Democratic politicians over several elections, and spent to buy the votes of more than 8,000 voters, usually at $50 apiece.

Topic.Title: I believe it is Americans literally reaching for the stars.

Message.Msg: Once again, dropkick proves what an ignorant dumbbutt he is.

Maybe 3 trillion or so is "owed" to SS , but is it due tommorrow or next year or the next or the next.... NO , it is not..... all total of debt the government owes it self is 30% of the total..... --------------------- Is all the debt due tomorrow or next year? No it is not. What's the difference? It is due at some date in the future like any other debt.

as i said, 10% of the national debt is just accounting for the federal reserve, if it gets paid back it goes straight to the treasury, so scrach that off. and there are other items like that. ------------------------------------------------- No only interests would be returned to the treasury. The principal would go back to the fiery printer from whence it came. And the Fed may or may not decide to roll it over depending on inflationary conditions. Your assumption that the Feds can forever provide the gov will near zero interests by printing money is inconsistent with the Federal reserve mandate on inflation. If inflation started going up, and rates with it, the government would immediately be in serious trouble on their current debt. See Spain: they are not in trouble because they pay 7% for 10 yrs. rates have been at 7% before, and there was no problem. But they have enough debt and deficit that they can't finance 7%. i.e. They are insolvent for all practical purpose.

Naz, you are wasting your time debating with someone who is relying on a CBO report from July 2010. Back then we had a Democrat dominated Congress and President. Who failed to take any sensible action on this. The first Debt Limit crisis was not until 18 months later in Dec-2011. And the report is fully 24 months out of date now. Yet messybrians argues from it as though it were current.
